fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes: Chang'an operates 6,000 sales and service facilities in over 60 countries, comprising over 150,000 professional employees globally.
fields.military_affiliation_in_china_or_not_not:
Chang’an’s early origins can be traced back to 1862 when Li Hongzhang, a Chinese diplomat of the late Qing dynasty, set up a military supply factory, the Shanghai Foreign Gun Bureau. In 1959, a predecessor entity, Chongqing Chang’an Arsenal, under contract to the government, began auto manufacturing and built Changjiang Type 46 vehicle, which was the first production vehicle of China. Changan introduced minicar by licensing from Suzuki.

However, since 2009, Chang’an has focused only on passenger cars, microvans, commercial vans, and light trucks production.
fields.excerpt: One of the “Big Four” Chinese automakers, Chang’an Automobile, is a Chinese state-owned automaker headquartered in Chongqing with a global footprint that includes 16 global production bases, 35 vehicle and engine plants, and 10 key overseas markets.
fields.overview:
Chang’an Automobile (长安 cháng’ān) is a Chinese state-owned automaker headquartered in Chongqing and a subsidiary of Chang’an Automobile Group. Founded in 1862, it is one of the “Big Four” Chinese automakers alongside SAIC, FAW, and Dongfeng. As a longtime player in China’s auto industry, Chang’an has a global footprint with 16 global production bases, 35 vehicle and engine plants, and 10 key overseas markets. It has been selected twice in CCTV’s “National Brand Project,” which bestows “national brand” status on certain brands.

Like other state-owned automakers, Chang’an has joint ventures with Western and Japanese counterparts, specifically Ford and Mazda. The company began exploring the smart EV space in 2016, announcing a formal partnership with Baidu in 2017. Last year, Chang’an also announced plans to work with Huawei on smart car tech. In August 2020, Chang’an released the first purely electric vehicle, a compact SUV, under its Oshan brand, the Oshan X7 EV.

fields.excerpt: Guangzhou Dongjing Computer Technology is a subsidiary of Alibaba Cultural Entertainment under Alibaba. The company owns UC Web, which is a mobile browser maker. UCWeb has also expanded to areas like app distribution, mobile game cooperation, mobile search, etc.
fields.overview:
Guangzhou Dongjing Computer Technology is a subsidiary of Alibaba Cultural Entertainment under Alibaba. The company owns UC Web, which is a mobile browser maker. UCWeb has also expanded to areas like app distribution, mobile game cooperation, mobile search, etc. 

In 2014, Alibaba Group has officially completed the acquisition and merger of UCWeb, China’s number one mobile browser company to form the UC Mobile Business Group. The UC mobile business group of Alibaba oversees the browser, mobile search, location-based services, mobile gaming, app store and mobile reader operations.

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes:
NetEase has advanced its games overseas and launched more than 50 mobile games in global markets since 2015. Mobile games such as Knives Out became popular in Japan since its launch in 2017 and even topped Japan’s IOS grossing chart multiple times in 2020. Identity V and Life-after were also games that appeared in Japan’s grossing chart various times in 2020. 

Building on its strong presence in the gaming industry, NetEase has formed strategic partnerships and collaborations with Blizzard, Marvel, Microsoft, and Warner Bros to develop and operate popular games such as World of Warcraft, Harry Potter: Magic Awakened, Minecraft, and MARVEL Super War.

fields.excerpt: Founded by DingLei in 1997, Guangzhou Netease Computer Systems provides a variety of services such as search engines, mobile games, music-streaming services, e-commerce, and online education. As of 2021, the company has 182.6 million active monthly users, and monthly paying users have increased by 80.6% to 28.9 million.
fields.overview:
_This is the profile for an operating company known as _Guangzhou Netease Computer Systems_. For the profile of the publicly listed company associated with, but distinct from this company, click here: NetEase, Inc._

Founded by DingLei in 1997, Guangzhou Netease Computer Systems provides a variety of services such as search engines, mobile games, music-streaming services, e-commerce, and online education. As of 2021, the company has 182.6 million active monthly users, and monthly paying users have increased by 80.6% to 28.9 million. In addition, the company had success, especially in developing and operating some of China's most popular mobile and computer games, including Fantasy Westward Journey Online, New Westward Journey Online II, Tianxia III, New Ghost, and Justice. It has expanded its gaming services into Japan and North America, launching more than 50 mobile games in global markets since 2015. Other innovative services that Netease offers include Youdao — China's leading intelligent learning company, NetEase Cloud Music — China's leading online music content community, and Yanxuan — NetEase's private label e-commerce platform.
fields.company_valuation_notes: Valuation was not publicly reported as of May 12, 2022. NetEase, Inc., this company’s publicly listed affiliate, is valued at USD 61.7 B.

fields.notes_on_ownership:
Being a Chinese SOE (CREC) is majority-owned by the Chinese government through related state-owned companies. It is owned through a holding company, China Railway Engineering Group Co., Ltd., which is consequently owned by China’s National Security Fund (10%) and State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Organization of the State Council (90%).

CREC is listed both on the Shanghai and Hong Kong stock exchanges as A shares, and H shares respectively. A shares are in large part exclusive to domestic investors of China and are valued/traded in RMB. H shares are valued/traded in HKD and can be traded by investors globally.
fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes:
As an SOE integral to China’s BRI policies, CREC has been vital in constructing railroads and infrastructure in Southeast Asia, the Middle East, Africa, and South America. Prominent examples include the China-Laos Railway and a USD 1.6 billion high-speed railway in Chile. Most recently, China inked a USD 7.2 B deal with Pakistan to link Pakistan’s Gwadar Port and Kashgar, China. Although CREC was not directly implicated in the deal, we can certainly expect the company to take a prominent role in this project.

Finally, CREC is the owner of key subsidiary China Overseas Engineering Group (“COVEC”), which solely focuses on foreign development generally as a part of BRI. COVEC not only works on railway development but also constructs affordable housing, such as in the development of Botswana real estate. COVEC generally focuses its efforts in Africa, where its standards of work and employee treatment have come under fire.
fields._subsidiaries_notes TEST: CREC has 51 total subsidiaries across 10 operational divisions, which include Infrastructure Construction, Overseas Projects, Real Estate Development, Investment, and others.
fields.reputational_disclosures_notes: CREC generally maintains a favorable public reputation and is generally praised in the mainland for fast turnarounds of high-powered railway and infrastructure projects domestically and abroad. CREC and its owner CRECG have received favorable reviews even in 2020, where CRECG received an A- Environment, Social, and Corporate Governance (“ESG”) rating by company Fitch Ratings in 2020, nothing that both companies have not been markedly impacted by COVID-19 in the same way other major SOEs in China have. However, the report notes “weakening linkages” between CRECG and CREC, which is something to keep an eye on in the future. In terms of reputational issues with CREC, the largest issues to be cognizant of are how CREC treats both foreign and imported workers on overseas projects as well as disregard for local communities. noted by the poor conditions described by COVEC employees, and general trends in BRI projects. For example, the China-Laos railway evicted many Laotian villagers from their homes “without proper compensation,” which directly involved CREC.
fields.reputational_disclosures_source: Sierra Leone News; Fitch Ratings; East Asia Forum
fields.excerpt: China Railway Engineering Corporation is a Chinese state-owned holding company that has major operations in railway construction, development, and engineering.
fields.overview:
China Railway Engineering Corporation (“CREC,” “中国中铁股份有限公司”) is a Chinese state-owned railway construction, development, and investment conglomerate. According to CREC sources, the company can be traced back to 1894 when China Shanhaiguan Manufactory (now a CREC subsidiary) constructed a railway between Beijing and Zhangjiakou. CREC was more formally incorporated in the 1950s as two separate entities, the General Bureau of Construction and the General Bureau of Design, by the Ministry of Railways. However, these two entities later merged, separated from the Ministry, and became CREC in 1989. CREC filed for IPOs on both the Shanghai and Hong Kong stock exchanges in 2007--the same year CREC’s larger holding company, CREC Group (“CRECG”), was formally established.

CREC has been recognized as integral player in China’s Belt and Road Initiative (一带一路, “BRI”), connecting China to other countries as well as developing the infrastructure of other countries. The most notable recent example of CREC’s BRI involvement include its construction on the China-Laos railway, turning Laos away from a landlocked state to major asian trade hub.
fields.company_valuation_notes: Valuation is reported as market capitalization. It was converted from HKD using the exchange rate from April 18, 2022 08:45:25.
fields._full_chinese_name: 中国中铁股份有限公司

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes: AutoX operates five R&D centers globally. While the large majority of AutoX operations take place in China (Shenzhen HQ, Changzhou Factory, and Beijing/Shanghai/Guangzhou R&D and Operations Centers), the company does run an R&D center in Silicon Valley. Additionally, AutoX has received California's second Driverless Permit by the California DMV.
fields.excerpt: AutoX is the frontrunner of RoboTaxi in China, with the mission of ‘Democratizing Autonomy’ to accelerate the advent of fully driverless cars. It was founded in 2016 by Dr. Jianxiong Xiao, a self-driving scientist from MIT and Princeton University. The company’s self-driving platform is capable of handling the most challenging and dynamic traffic scenarios in urban cities around the world.
fields.overview: AutoX is the frontrunner of RoboTaxi in China, with the mission of ‘Democratizing Autonomy’ to accelerate the advent of fully driverless cars. It was founded in 2016 by Dr. Jianxiong Xiao, a self-driving scientist from MIT and Princeton University. The company’s self-driving platform is capable of handling the most challenging and dynamic traffic scenarios in urban cities around the world. AutoX operates the largest RoboTaxi fleet in China, including Shenzhen, Guangzhou, Shanghai, and Beijing. AutoX is the first and right now the only company in China operating a fully driverless RoboTaxi service on public roads without any safety driver. AutoX also obtained the World's second driverless RoboTaxi permit from California. Headquartered in Shenzhen, AutoX has the largest autonomous driving engineering team in China, with five R&D centers globally.

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes:
Having grown its overseas correspondent bank network to 707 banks in 106 countries and regions around the world, China Development Bank now offers international products including loan financing, equity investment, proprietary investment, international settlements, cross-border RMB settlements, as well as consulting services. Two main focuses of CDB abroad currently are implementing the BRI and contributing to the internationalization and offshoring of the RMB.

CDB's primary overseas branches in Greater China area (Hong Kong), EMEA area (Egypt, Russia, UK, Kazakhstan, Belarus), LATAM area (Brazil and Venezuela), SE Asia (Indonesia and Laos), and Australia.
fields.reputational_disclosures_notes:
1\. March 2021 - CDB-Hainan fined RMB 42.7 M by CBIRC for illicitly providing a cross-border guarantee to a company linked to HNA Group, Ltd.
2\. January 2021 - CDB fined RMB 48.8 M by CBIRC for illegally financing government purchases of service projects and collecting loan commitment fees.
3\. September 2017 - CDB agrees to back $15 billion in development projects in heavily-sanctioned Iran.
fields.military_affiliation_in_china_or_not_not: The China Development Bank had provided loans to Hong Kong Skyrizon Holdings Limited, which was passed on to its subsidiary, the BVI-registered Skyrizon Aircraft Holdings. In 2015, Skyrizon signed a memorandum of cooperation with Ukraine's Motor Sich. Motor Sich is one of the largest engine manufacturers for airplanes, Mi-series, and Ka-series military helicopters worldwide.
fields.military_affiliation_in_china_or_not_sou: The Center for European Policy Analysis
fields.excerpt: Founded in 1994, China Development Bank (CDB) is a state-funded and state-owned development finance institute. It mainly engaged in medium and long-term lending and investment to support the implementation of major strategies for medium and long-term development of China’s national economy.
fields.overview:
_This is the profile for an operating company known as China Development Bank. For the profile of the publicly listed company associated with, but distinct from this company, click here: [China Development Bank International Investment](https://supchina.com/company-profiles/china-development-bank-international-investment/)._

Founded in 1994, China Development Bank (CDB) is a state-funded and state-owned development finance institute. CDB has played an active, counter-cyclical role as a development finance institution, mobilizing economic resources towards key areas such as socioeconomic development, urban-rural integration, upgrading and restructuring of traditional industries, public welfare, science and technologies, the Belt and Road Initiative, and financial reform. It mainly engaged in medium and long-term lending and investment to support the implementation of major strategies for medium and long-term development of China’s national economy. Some important projects include Yinchuan-Xi’an Rail Line, Bazhong-Wanyuan Expressway in Sichuan, Unit 5 & 6 of the Fuqing Nuclear Power Plant in Fujian, Datengxia Water Conservancy Project, Nanjing Urban Rail Project, New Airport in Qingdao and Digital Fujian Cloud Computing Center.
fields.company_valuation_notes: Valuation was not publicly reported as of April 5, 2022. China Development Bank International Investment, this company’s publicly listed affiliate, is valued at USD 49.3 M.”
fields.company_valuation_source: China Development Bank International Investment 2020 Annual Report

fields.excerpt: In April 2021, Kongzhong formally started using “War Flames Interactive Entertainment” as new brand identification. War Flames is an internet company providing “Three in one” solutions for game development, agency and operation, the successor of Kongzhong.
fields.overview:
In April 2021, Kongzhong formally started using “War Flames Interactive Entertainment” as new brand identification. War Flames is an internet company providing “Three in one” solutions for game development, agency and operation, the successor of Kongzhong. War Flames is not only a pioneer game company in China, but also a game culture company thinking globally. With enterprise tactics such as “Focus on top quality”, ”Think globally” and “Incubate IPs” , War Flames will bring high-quality Chinese games and culture to the world.

The logo of War Flames inherits the orange hue from Kongzhong. The main part of the logo is the "flame" image with low polygon, highlighting the attributes of the game industry and cultural entertainment. Rich colors and serrated shapes represent various game categories and company business respectively.

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes:
Kuaishou first made its way abroad in May 2017, launching Kwai in Thailand, Indonesia, South Korea, and Russia. The app picked up some traction, especially in South Korea, where it was downloaded 10 million times in less than a month. However, its popularity was quickly disrupted with the rise of TikTok in 2018. 

In the first quarter of 2021, Kuaishou has an average monthly active users exceeding 100 million and over 150 million in April 2021.
 
After the merger of Kwai Latin America, Kwai Middle East, and Snack Video, the company’s current overseas expansion targets South America and Southeast Asia.
fields.overseas_operations_or_not_source: 1. Kuaishou Technology First Quarter Report (2021) 2. LatePost 3. South China Morning Post
fields.reputational_disclosures_notes: Although Kuaishou saw its revenue rise amid the recent regulatory crackdown, the company is not immune to the longer term effects of said crackdown. Kuaishou recently began a new round of layoffs targeted at mid-level managers and low-performing employees. Reports indicate that around 30% of its staff will be cut with a focus on the company's international business division. These layoffs are part of a larger trend in the Chinese internet industry with both iQiyi and ByteDance recently laying off significant numbers of employees as well.
fields.excerpt: Kuaishou (快手 kuàishǒu), operator of China's second-largest short video-sharing app, makes content production, distribution, and consumption fast and easy. The company has 1 billion monthly users worldwide, with a particularly strong user base outside of China's Tier 1 cities.
fields.overview:
Kuaishou (快手 kuàishǒu), operator of China's second-largest short video-sharing app, makes content production, distribution, and consumption fast and easy. The company has 1 billion monthly users worldwide, with a particularly strong user base outside of China's Tier 1 cities. Kuaishou topped Google Play and Apple App Store’s Most Downloaded lists in eight countries in 2020 and active users on the platform spent an average of more than 100 minutes daily on its main app.

Compared to Douyin, China’s largest short video-sharing app , Kuaishou is relatively more popular with an older public. Its initial popularity originated around videos of Chinese rural life and Kuaishou relies more on e-commerce revenue than on advertising revenue relative to its main competitor.
fields.overview_source: 1. South China Morning Post 2. Business Insider 3. WalkTheChat

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes:
Gotion High-tech's patented technologies are distributed in many overseas countries and regions such as Europe, the United States, Japan, and South Korea. Overseas revenue makes up about 2.36% of Gotion's High-tech revenue. 

In 2020, the company also partnered with the Volkswagen Group to become a certified supplier of Volkswagen. The two companies would also be jointly carrying out innovative research and development of battery technology in Hefei. Gotion High-tech aims to make Hefei the frontier of China's electric vehicle industry.
fields.excerpt: Gotion High-tech manufactures, markets, researches, and develops lithium-ion power batteries. Its main products include lithium-ion batteries, battery management systems, and energy storage battery packs. Gotion High-tech products are widely used in the field of electric vehicles and have established long-term strategic cooperative relations with many Chinese domestic electric vehicles enterprises.
fields.overview: Gotion High-tech manufactures, markets, researches, and develops lithium-ion power batteries. The company is one of the earliest domestic enterprises to engage in independent R&D and the production of lithium-ion-powered electric vehicles. Its main products include lithium-ion batteries, battery management systems, and energy storage battery packs. Gotion High-tech products are widely used in the field of electric vehicles and have established long-term strategic cooperative relations with many Chinese domestic electric vehicles enterprises. As of 2021, Gotion High-tech had applied for a total of 5,341 patents. A total of 3,333 patents were authorized, including 810 invention patents (65 foreign invention patents), 2,166 utility model patents, and 357 design patents.

fields.overview:
Shenzhen Smart Drone UAV Co., Ltd. (SMD) is committed to the R&D, manufacturing and sales of professional unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs). SMD owns a modernized R&D and manufacturing base and a flight testing site of over 20,000 square meters.

SMD's flagship V200, V330, and V380 drones are tilt-rotor VTOL fixed-wing type, which combines the technical advantages of VTOL and fixed-wing drones, and are widely used in various industrial applications including security and defense, logistics, survey and mapping, inspection, and more.

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes: In September 2021, 36Kr Global, a joint venture between 36Kr Holdings Inc. and Lotus Walk Inc., entered the European and Australia & New Zealand markets. 36Kr Global established on-site operational teams to expand into European and Australia & New Zealand markets by reporting regional business news, providing bi-lateral and multi-lateral business intelligence, as well as building media outlets KrEurope and Kr-ANZ to cater to local readers and clients. 36Kr Global also owns kr-asia.com in Singapore and 36kr.jp in Japan.
fields._subsidiaries_notes TEST: 36Kr Holdings has 4 domestic subsidiaries and 60 overseas subsidiaries.
fields.reputational_disclosures_notes: Jack Ma’s Ant Group has sold its entire stake in the tech outlet 36Kr Holdings Inc., in its bid to comply with the demands of China’s regulators and exit media businesses.
fields.excerpt: 36Kr is an online news platform that summarizes business and economic news by aggregating company reports and articles from other media organizations, and publishing original reporting and commentary. The company also offers services for institutional investors to invest in evolving industries and identify promising startup companies.
fields.overview:
_This is the profile for a publicly listed company known as 36Kr Holdings, Inc. For the profile of the operating company associated with, but distinct from this company, click here: [Beijing Pingxin Media Culture](https://supchina.com/company-profiles/beijing-pingxin-media-culture/)._

36Kr is an online news platform that summarizes business and economic news by aggregating company reports and articles from other media organizations, and publishing original reporting and commentary.  The company also offers services for institutional investors to invest in evolving industries and identify locate promising startup companies. It also helps provincial governments to digitize their working process and energize the regional economy through its service solutions such as online advertising, live-streaming events, and innovative and creative consulting services. 

In 2019, 36Kr Holdings went public at $14.5 per share and raised $22 million in its initial public offering.

fields.overview: Muyuan Foods is a comprehensive company, which has established a live pig industry chain integrating feed processing, live pig breeding, and slaughtering. The company's business covers 24 provinces across the country. Using new technologies such as big data analysis, forecasting and the IoT, Muyuan has built an intelligent digital platform for feed processing, pig breeding and pig sales.

fields.excerpt: T3 Mobile Travel Services is a technology company that offers car-sharing services powered by renewable energy. It is a joint venture by three leading Chinese automakers Changan Automobile, FAW Group, and Dongfeng Motor.
fields.overview:
T3 Mobile Travel Services is a technology company that offers car-sharing services powered by renewable energy. 
It is a joint venture by three leading Chinese automakers Changan Automobile, FAW Group, and Dongfeng Motor, and is set to compete with DiDi Chuxing, China's largest ride-hailing company.

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes: Genki has sales in over 40 countries and 300 cities across North America, Asia, and Oceania.
fields._subsidiaries_notes TEST: Genki Forest has wholly-owned subsidiaries in cities throughout China, and also in new product offerings such as its yogurt subsidiary, Hokkai Pastures.
fields.excerpt: Genki Forest is a fast-growing beverage company focusing on healthy, fizzy drinks, with a particular focus on the tech side of the business and a penchant for using Japanese-styled branding on its products. Valued at around $6.0 B, Genki has carved out a sizeable niche for itself in China's large beverage market.
fields.overview: Founded in Beijing in 2016, Genki Forest is a beverage company that offers healthy, hip alternatives to the fizzy, sugar-infused soft drinks dominant in the beverage market. Specializing in sugar-free, low-calorie drinks, its product portfolio includes sparkling water, tea, sports drinks, energy drinks, milk tea, and yogurt. As a self-described tech company, it sees its R&D and manufacturing innovations as the main value to customers. Genki began establishing R&D centers in 2015, before entering the market in 2017. Backed by big-name firms like Sequoia Capital, Genki has now reached a $6.0 B valuation in China's massive beverage market, which totals near $200.0 B.
fields.company_valuation_notes: Valuation was last reported on November 5, 2021.

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes: iQIYI's subsidiary, iQIYI International, is based in Singapore and offers services to international users. iQIYI began expanding its overseas business in late 2019, launching its multilingual iQIYI app which currently supports ten languages and can be downloaded globally from Android and iOS app stores.
fields.overseas_operations_or_not_source: iQIYI International Website; iQIYI 2020 Annual Report
fields._subsidiaries_notes TEST: iQiyi has 13 domestic subsidiaries and 4 overseas subsidiaries.
fields.reputational_disclosures_notes:
In May 2021, iQIYI was fined a little less than $5,000 for publishing vulgar content including swear words, apparently a frequent though minor infraction.

In August 2020, iQIYI came under investigation by the SEC in late 2020 after the short-seller investment-research firm Wolfpack Research claimed iQIYI was overstating its revenues, after which its shares tumbled 11%. The same month, iQIYI was also fined a total of about $10,000 for video games "inducing minors to commit illegal crimes and exaggerate violence, terrorist activities, etc." and for publishing prohibited content.

In April 2020, iQIYI was accused of fraud and inflating its financial numbers by a research firm backed by Muddy Waters. The company disputed the allegations.
fields.excerpt: iQIYI is a leading Chinese online entertainment service that was launched in Beijing on April 22, 2010, and has since grown to be one of the world's largest online entertainment platforms. Controlled by internet search giant Baidu, iQIYI creates online entertainment content and provides internet video streaming of both original content and licensed external videos in China. In 2021, iQIYI experienced a dip in monthly active users due to the increase in membership prices for streaming services.
fields.overview:
_This is the profile for a publicly listed company known as _iQiyi, Inc_. For the profile of the operating company associated with, but distinct from this company, click here: Beijing iQiyi._

iQiyi is a leading Chinese online entertainment service that was launched in Beijing on April 22, 2010, and has since grown to be one of the world's largest online entertainment platforms. Controlled by internet search giant Baidu, iQiyi creates online entertainment content and provides internet video streaming of both original content and licensed external videos in China. It distinguishes itself by its proprietary AI and big data analytics technologies. Its main competitors include Tencent Video and Bilibili. The two key sources of revenue are membership services and online advertising services. 

In 2021, iQiyi recorded a monthly active users average of 428.6 million, with users spending 6.4 billion hours per month watching video content on the platform. This is a decrease from 2020's active users average of 479.8 million, with users spending 8.4 billion hours per month watching video content. iQiyi experienced a dip in monthly active users due to the increase in membership prices for streaming services.

iQiyi went public in 2018 at USD 18 per share and raised USD 2.3 billion in its initial public offering.

fields.military_affiliation_in_china_or_not_not: CASIL has connections to the military industry. Burhill Company Limited, CASIL's shareholder, is a wholly-owned subsidiary of China Aerospace Science & Technology Corporation (CASC). CASC is the state-owned rocket manufacturer and main contractor for the Chinese space program.
fields.excerpt: Founded in 1975, CASIL mainly engages in Hi-tech manufacturing and aerospace service business. The company has a research and development academy, which focuses on new technology development, research and development of hi-tech products, nurturing of high-caliber scientific research talents, and incubation of industrialized projects. It went public on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in 1981.
fields.overview:
_This is the profile for a publicly listed company known as CASIL. For the profile of the operating company associated with, but distinct from this company, click here: CASC. _

Founded in 1975, CASIL mainly engages in Hi-tech manufacturing and aerospace service business. The company has a research and development academy, which focuses on new technology development, research and development of hi-tech products, nurturing of high-caliber scientific research talents, and incubation of industrialized projects. Its plastic injection molding business is also engaged in emerging market segments such as new energy vehicles, intelligent equipment and robots, which drove the growth of its sales. Part of CASIL's revenue also comes from its operation of property investments and management through Shenzhen Aerospace Science & Technology Plaza.

CASIL went public on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in 1981.

fields.excerpt: JD Technology, previously known as JD Digits and JD Finance, is a financial technology company that provides digital solutions for financial institutions, businesses, and governments.
fields.overview:
JD Technology is a subsidiary of e-commerce giant JD.com reconstructed from JD Digits, a fintech company. Once called JD Finance, the company operates an investment and financing platform that provides customized financial services to financial institutions, businesses, and governments. The rebranding is motivated in part by the various services under the company: JD Technology encompasses JD’s cloud, artificial intelligence, and IoT offerings.

JD Technology withdrew a planned Shanghai STAR Market IPO in April 2021 amid China’s antitrust regulations in the fintech sector,  including authorities' halting of Ant Group’s IPO in Hong Kong and Shanghai. The company plans on resubmitting its IPO at a future date.
fields.company_valuation_notes: Valuation was last reported on April 2021, before the company's aborted IPO.

Its business goes beyond home appliances and comprises business pillars like HVAC, robotics and automation, smart home and IoT, as well as smart logistics and components. Midea Group's new IoT operating system is backed by Huawei's HarmonyOS.
fields.overview:
Midea Group is a leading global high-technology company ranked No. 288 in the 2021 Global Fortune 500. Midea Group’s business goes beyond home appliances, including business pillars like HVAC, robotics and automation, smart home devices and IoT, as well as smart logistics and components. 

In October 2021, Midea Group has launched the first version of its internet of things operating system, backed by Huawei's HarmonyOS.

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes: Xpeng has R&D center in Silicon Valley and San Diego. The vast majority of XPeng's sale is in China, but the company began to expand overseas market and began to export to Europe in late 2020.
fields.excerpt: Xpeng Motors is a leading Chinese smart electric vehicle company.
fields.overview:
Smart EV maker Xpeng (小鹏) was founded in August 2014 by former Alibaba executive and namesake He Xiaopeng 何小鹏. The company is headquartered in Guangzhou with an office in Mountain View, California. The senior executive team consists of former employees of Guangzhou Auto, a top Chinese manufacturer, Ford, BMW, and Tesla.

In addition to Alibaba, which currently owns a 14% stake in the startup, Xpeng has drawn its employees from many well-known tech giants, including Xiaomi, Tencent, Samsung, and Huawei. Their expertise has helped Xpeng become competitive in smart car technologies.

On November 13, 2019, the startup completed a $400 million Series C financing round with investors including Xiaomi and the company founder, He. On April 13, 2021, the company announced that it was considering making its own semiconductors. Currently, for its P5 model, debuting in the Shanghai Auto Show on April 21, the company buys chips from Nvidia for autonomous driving and from Qualcomm for its in-car digital cockpit.
fields.company_valuation_notes: Valuation is reported as enterprise value.
fields._full_english_name: Guangzhou Xiaopeng Motors Technology Co., Ltd.
fields._full_chinese_name: 广州小鹏汽车科技有限公司

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes: Cheetah Mobile owns and operates multiple mobile applications that are based on global platforms.
fields._subsidiaries_notes TEST: Cheetah Mobile currently has 6 subsidiaries. Of the 6 subsidiaries, 2 are wholly-owned and 4 are minority-owned.
fields.reputational_disclosures_notes: In 2018, Cheetah Mobile had a number of its apps removed from the Google Play store after Google cited allegations of ad fraud.
fields.excerpt: Cheetah Mobile is a leading internet company. It has attracted hundreds of millions of monthly active users through an array of internet products such as Clean Master, Security Master and several casual games. The Company provides advertising services to advertisers worldwide as well as value-added services including the sale of premium membership and in-app virtual items to its users. Cheetah Mobile is also committed to leveraging its cutting-edge artificial intelligence technologies to power its products and make the world smarter. It has been listed on the New York Stock Exchange since May 2014.
fields.overview:
Cheetah Mobile (NYSE:CMCM) was founded in November 2010 by Fu Sheng. The company is committed to "Using technology to improve people's lives in a world where humans and machines coexist". The company became listed on New York Stock Exchange on May 8, 2014. Drawing strength from its original businesses, Cheetah Mobile is on a strategic upgrading path from the mobile internet to the AI-driven industrial internet and has built up the AI capability for vertical integration, including independently-developed chip computing power, algorithm capabilities, system capacities, app capabilities, and the business brain.
Specifically, its algorithm capabilities include the whole-chain speech technology (mouth), the microphone array (ear), the total-sense visual recognition (eye), the indoor navigation platform (leg) and the six-axis mechanical arms (hand). Besides, it has also established three open systems of OrionStar Speech OS, OrionStar Robot OS and OrionStar Arm OS to deliver intelligent service robot solutions based on intelligent speech-based service robots, intelligent delivery service robots, and intelligent labor service robots. Meanwhile, AI-empowered solutions that cover speech, chip, vision, intelligent self-help devices, and indoor autonomous navigation solutions are also provided. With "intelligent service robots" and "AI-empowered" businesses as carriers, Cheetah Mobile is well poised for the upcoming intelligent upgrading of services and products in the AI and 5G era. Cheetah Mobile empowers industries with AI technologies in pursuit of discontinuous growth, aiming to become a world-leading AI industrial Internet player.
fields.company_valuation_notes: Data based on Yahoo Finance information. Conversion from RMB to USD based on 3/3/22 rates.

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes: After extensive research, we were unable to find any overseas operations for Manner Coffee.
fields.excerpt: Manner Coffee began in 2015 as a single roadside stall with lines that spilled directly onto a crowded Shanghai street. Today, it has over 300 stores, most of them in Shanghai, and is planning a Hong Kong IPO to raise as much as $300.0 M to continue its expansion.
fields.overview:
Manner Coffee began in 2015 as a single roadside stall with lines that spilled directly onto a crowded Shanghai street. Today, it has over 300 stores, most of them in Shanghai, and is planning a Hong Kong IPO to raise as much as $300.0 M to continue its expansion.

Manner set itself apart by honing in on a younger crowd. It has quickly become known for its creamy flat whites, a chic store design, and prices 30% to 40% lower than Western chains. It's also eco-friendly: Customers who bring their own cup can get a coffee for just RMB 10.0 (USD 1.50).

Manner received its first investment from Today Capital in October 2018, then the following year, it began its national expansion after a $12.0 M Series A investment from Today Capital. It added stores in five cities: Suzhou, Beijing, Chengdu, Xiamen, and Shenzhen.

2021 has been a watershed year for the company. Thanks to investments from Temasek, Meituan, and ByteDance, from June to October, it built around 150 new stores — more than one every day.
fields._full_chinese_name: 上海茵赫实业有限公司

fields.excerpt: Beijing Taobao Technology is a subsidiary of Taobao (China) Software. The company’s main business scope includes technology promotion services, computer system services, economic and trade consulting, education consulting (excluding study abroad consulting and intermediary services), food sales, publications retailing, and wholesale.

fields.overseas_operations_or_not_notes: The MissFresh purchasing teams go to the United States, Chile, South Africa, Peru, Australia and other countries to select high-quality ingredients.
fields._subsidiaries_notes TEST: Missfresh Ltd. is incorporated in the Cayman Islands and its primary subsidiary is incorporated in Hong Kong. Its principal subsidiaries include: Beijing Missfresh E-commerce Co., Ltd., Beijing Missfresh Bianligou E-commerce Co., Ltd., Jinan Missfresh Bianligou Network Technology Co., Ltd., Changshu Missfresh E-commerce Co., Ltd., Qingdao Missfresh E-commerce Co., Ltd., Qingdao Daily Market Technology Co., Ltd., Changshu Daily Technology Co., Ltd.
fields.reputational_disclosures_notes:
On April 14, 2021, MissFresh was summoned by the State Administration for Market Regulation (SAMR) where it was urged to correct anti-competitive practices after SAMR's record fine of Alibaba.

On October 22, 2020, MissFresh was warned by SAMR for selling "substandard" food. It was the third time of the year that MissFresh was warned.
fields.excerpt: MissFresh is an e-commerce platform centered on fresh food delivery that utilizes a "distributed mini-warehouse" model and is looking to platformize its model.
fields.overview: Founded in 2014, MissFresh is a pioneer of the “distributed mini-warehouse” model which refers to the placement of warehouses in close proximity to customers for faster delivery times. Compared to its competitor Dingdong Maicai, MissFresh occupies 28% of the Chinese market and is a more established player in the grocery-buying market, which has seen explosive growth since the pandemic supercharged online demand for fresh produce last year. MissFresh seeks to “platformize” its pioneering business model — a nod to the “platform as a service” business models (PaaS) of Alibaba and Tencent — by opening its platform to other neighborhood retail businesses and supermarkets, citing a recent “retail cloud business” initiative. Despite having failed to turn a profit since 2018, MissFresh listed on Nasdaq on June 25, 2021, raising $273 million, but its shares plunged 26% on the first day of trading. Its shares continued falling as China carried out its crackdown on private technology companies, down 37% a month after its IPO.
fields.company_valuation_notes: Valuation is reported as market capitalization. It was last updated on May 14, 2022 16:51:36.
